comment.brief: The index/position of the data items is treated as the axis. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0, the next a value of 1, etc.
comment.full: The index/position of the data items is treated as the axis. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0, the next a value of 1, etc.

comment.brief: A variant of Count that positions the data items in the center of the indexed regions. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0.5, the next 1.5, etc.
comment.full: A variant of Count that positions the data items in the center of the indexed regions. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0.5, the next 1.5, etc.

comment.brief: The axis covers the range of values present in the data
comment.full: The axis covers the range of values present in the data

comment.brief: The range continues the range of the previous axis
comment.full: The range continues the range of the previous axis

comment.brief: A variant of Count that positions the data items in the center of the indexed regions. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0.5, the next 1.5, etc.
comment.full: A variant of Count that positions the data items in the center of the indexed regions. For example, on the XAxis the first item in the source data gets a value of 0.5, the next 1.5, etc.
